item.title: Focus on autonomous vehicles, EU expansion drive KPIT’s growth
item.description: Despite global challenges like supply chain issues and the rise of AI, KPIT Technologies has continued to grow, CEO Kishor Patil told ET. This is due to the company's smart investments in areas like EVs and self-driving cars, along with their timely expansion into European markets, he added.

item.title: Ola has exited Google Maps, moved to in-house navigation system: Bhavish Aggarwal
item.description: Bhavish Aggarwal, cofounder of Ola Cabs, said the company will now use its in-house navigation system, exiting Google Maps. This comes a month after Ola took its IT workload off Microsoft Azure. The ride-hailing company will add features, including street view, neural radiance fields, indoor images, 3D maps and drone maps to Ola Maps, Aggarwal said in a post on X.

item.title: TVS Motor prepares for the SDV ride, with a ‘keep it simple’ strategy
item.description: An early mover in the connected two-wheeler space, the two-wheeler major designs a ‘TVSM North Star’ on-board SDV architecture, and also an off board ‘TVSM Cloud’ to enhance its product appeal, keep models fresh and up to date, and an improved customer experience.

item.title: Carmaker Stellantis joins forces with France's CEA for EV battery research
item.description: "We know that battery technology is poised for change. While we don't know exactly how it will change, we are committed to be at the forefront of this transformation. Internally, we are working around the clock placing multiple bets and exploring various technologies," Stellantis Chief Engineering and Technology Officer Ned Curic said.

item.title: Mahindra deploying multiple AI tools across manufacturing plants as it lines up mega investment
item.description: Increasingly, makers of components as well as vehicles are deploying cutting edge AI and ML tools across their manufacturing facilities to lower costs and improve efficiencies. Coupled with cheaper labour and some other inherent advantages, like the ‘China Plus One’ strategy adopted by large global suppliers, India’s chances could become brighter.

item.title: ABB's PixelPaint technology chosen by Mahindra for premium paint options
item.description: Mahindra & Mahindra's adoption of PixelPaint technology for their new electric vehicles promises enhanced and luxurious paint finishes, solidifying their position in the market with advanced capabilities and detailed customization options.

item.title: Altair and Metrics collaborate to redefine semiconductor design verification
item.description: Metrics' DSim, when integrated with Altair’s tools, will offer an advanced simulation environment featuring superior simulation and debug capabilities. This synergy promises a transformative impact on the semiconductor industry by making high-quality EDA design tools more affordable and accessible, particularly for companies seeking to scale up simulations to accelerate their design cycles.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz Research and Development India collaborates with BITS Pilani for advanced technology research
item.description: The partnership is centered on breakthroughs in the mobility sector, exploring and developing advanced technologies. It will include joint R&D projects, academic and professional events, and the exchange of researchers and students. The collaboration also involves sharing lab facilities, advising research students, obtaining co-funding, publishing research papers, and protecting intellectual property.

item.title: Newton’s law guides Ashok Leyland’s next level of innovations
item.description: An advanced engineering team at the commercial vehicle major works on a ‘Newton Truck’ concept to achieve as minimal as possible use of energy, with innovations based on Newton’s second law of motion -– F=ma. The results could be big gains for its EVs especially.

item.title: Autonomous car rules advancing faster than the vehicles themselves: UN
item.description: Fully autonomous cars are still years away from hitting the streets, but internationally-agreed rules on their use could be ready by mid-2026, the United Nations has said. Furthermore, "we are planning to have a globally harmonised regulation on Automated Driving Systems (ADS) ready for mid-2026", he said.

item.title: Explainer: What's behind Volkswagen's USD 5 billion EV software bet on Rivian?
item.description: The tie-up is the latest in a string of deals by Volkswagen Chief Executive Oliver Blume, who took over in September 2022 after the ousting of Herbert Diess. Shifting from combustion engine to electric cars requires expertise in areas where historically Volkswagen has little experience, from charging to batteries to software.

item.title: Tata Motors CV earmarks 40% of its investment this year on advanced technologies
item.description: Part of the investment will also go in building software technology capabilities, which is crucial for SDV (Software Defined Vehicle) technology development.

item.title: Waymo robotaxi service opens to all in San Francisco
item.description: The Google-owned Waymo robotaxi service on Tuesday became available to anyone in San Francisco interested in hailing a driverless ride. Waymo One ride-hailing is now available in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Phoenix, with plans to "ramp up" in Austin next.

item.title: Volkswagen to invest up to USD 5 bn in EV maker Rivian as part of tech joint venture
item.description: The auto industry faces a crucial time as EV startups grapple with a slowdown in demand amid high interest rates and dwindling cash, while traditional automakers have struggled to build battery-powered vehicles and advanced software.

item.title: CDK auto dealer software unlikely to be restored before June end, says memo
item.description: The car industry technology and software provider would not be able to get all dealers live before June 30, and has asked them to make alternate plans for their month-end financial closing processes, the memo CDK sent to dealers showed.

item.title: For Tesla's futuristic new Cybertruck, a fourth recall
item.description: The company says in the documents that the front windshield wiper motor controller can stop working because it's getting too much electrical current. A wiper that fails can cut visibility, increasing the risk of a crash. The Austin, Texas, company says it knows of no crashes or injuries caused by the problem.

item.title: Auto LPG could be a game changer in reducing emissions with appropriate fiscal incentives: IAC Director
item.description: Noted for its clean-burning properties, Auto LPG significantly reduces emissions of particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, and carbon dioxide, thereby contributing to improved air quality and reducing the overall carbon footprint of the nation.

item.title: Revolutionising MSME automobile dealerships with affordable AI-Driven ERP Solutions
item.description: The MSME sector is a crucial part of the Indian economy but often lacks accessible technology solutions. Traditional ERP systems are usually expensive and have long implementation times, failing to address the specific needs of smaller verticals effectively. Readywire intends to close this gap by offering affordable AI-driven ERP solutions tailored for automobile dealerships, aiming to streamline their business processes and improve operational efficiency.

item.title: Fed up of traffic jams? By 2030, you may have air taxis in Hyderabad
item.description: Chennai-based The ePlane Company and Bengaluru-based Leap Aeronautics are also part of the initiative to introduce eVTOLs for urban air mobility in India by 2030.

item.title: Car dealerships in North America revert to pens and paper after cyberattacks on software provider
item.description: On Monday, Group 1 Automotive Inc., a USD 4 billion automotive retailer, said it is using "alternative processes" to sell cars to its customers. Lithia Motors and AutoNation, two other dealership chains, also disclosed that they implemented workarounds to keep their operations going.
